reasoning: Thrombophilia prevalence estimated at ~5% (5,000 per 100k) globally based on combined frequency of major genetic variants (Factor V Leiden ~3-5%, Prothrombin G20210A ~2-3% in European populations, with lower prevalence in Asian and African populations). Reported as prevalence (lifelong predisposition) rather than incidence. Umbrella term encompassing inherited (Factor V Leiden, Prothrombin mutation, Antithrombin deficiency, Protein C/S deficiency) and acquired forms.
source: Heit JA et al. (2016). Thrombophilia: clinical and molecular epidemiology. Am J Med Genet C Semin Med Genet. 175C(1):22-39
